alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 11:49AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Buckingham. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding along the Slate River, and low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 AM EDT, The Slate River at Arvonia was at 13.2 feet. The river has crested and should slowly fall through the afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Rocky Creek, Slate River and James River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly wooded and farmland areas of Northeastern Buckingham County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. During high water, river banks become unstable and unsafe.
